intro: Lagotis brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed lagotis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
